result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Pierce

defendant.name: Pierce, Christopher J
defendant.address: W1665 County Rd T, Mt. Calvary, WI 53057

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

3:58 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Amaro Lopez.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lopez, is not hired to represent the defendant on the new case.  Atty Lopez recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 on 2014CF26, count 2 on 2014CM21, count 1 on 2014CT25, all other charges are to be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2014CF26, count 2 on 2014CM21 and count 1 on 2014CT25.  Court orders the PAC charge be dismissed and orders all other charges be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Lopez.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF26 (Count 1) & 2014CM21 (Count 2):

Sentence Withheld and places the defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-AODA (if the agent deems that the AODA that is to be done on the OWI-3rd will be ok - court leaves it up to the agent)
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.


2014CT25 (Count 1)

-50 days county jail with huber, to commence immediately.
-$650.00 Fine and costs totalling $1757.00
-D.L. revocation for 27 months
-IID for 27 months
-AODA

Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court orders the bond of $500.00 on 2014CF26 be applied to the court costs on each case and one week of sentence credit (7 days) is to be applied to 2014CF26.

Court adjourned at 4:21 p.m.

Note:  After court - Court has no objection to the defendant serving the sentence in Fond du lac County.
Notice of Hearing for plea & sentencing scheduled on 01/12/2105 at 3:30 p.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

3:14 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Amaro Lopez.

2014CF116
Attorney Lopez indicates the defendant is waiving his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Lopez.  Attorney Lopez confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs all cases be set for Plea/Sentencing after the 1st of the year.

Court adjourned at 3:18 p.m.
Defendant's Invocation of Right to Counsel
Demand list and items moved for in Discovery
Notice of hearing for Status Hearing scheduled on 11/24/2014 at 3:00 p.m. has  been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to Forward.
Status hearing on November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

3:42 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Lopez.

Statement by Attorney Lopez - requests Preliminary Hearing be scheduled on 2014CF116 and Status Hearing for the other cases.

Court directs all cases be set for Status Hearing.

Court adjourned at 3:45 p.m.

No Contact with Benjamin A. or Marjorie H.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Warrant has been canceled - talked with Majkin F.

1:12 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Benjamin A. or Marjorie H.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will see defendant on Tuesday when other cases are set for plea & sentencing.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.
